result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan W. Riggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan W. Riggs

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Nathan W. Riggs
Current: 713 Badger Ct, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 07-07-2022)
Prior: 337 Robert St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

[ml] Case called at 11:49AM
[Court Reporter Edward Johnson]
Defendant Nathan W. Riggs in court with Attorney Eric P Habich. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin, substituted mid-hearing by DA Monica Hall.
The Court grants the State leave to amend the Information; the State provides courtesy copies to the Defense and the Court. This Amended Information modifies Count #1 to a misdemeanor.

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered as to Amended Count #1 and Count #2; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming per Agent
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--payment of fees and other costs

The Court orders the Defendant to appear before the Jefferson County Probation Office no later than 3:00PM today.

The Court orders the DOC to collect any fees and other costs in this file. [Clerk calculates this total to be: $886.00]

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for expungement for reasons stated on the record.

Days credit for time already served: 3 days

The Defendant provides an updated address: 713 Badger Ct, Fort Atkinson, WI.

recess 12:08PM

Pre-trial conference on June 8, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

[ma] Case called at 9:00am 
Defendant Nathan W. Riggs in court with Attorney Eric P Habich.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr. Riggs waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 9:05am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/8/22 at 2:40pm     (2) Status Conference on 7/7/22 at 11:30am

Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 048307,
Payable Number: 189520,
Receipt Number: 22R 003236,
Amount: $20.00

Conditions of Bond include:
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of any alcohol, no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription; to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no discussion of this case with the passenger Gabriel Maier
--Mr. Riggs is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[MK] case called at 1:49pm 
Defendant Nathan W. Riggs appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  His counsel, Attorney Eric Habich, appears by telephone. DA Monica Hall appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist on the four corners of the Complaint.  

The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of any alcohol, no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription; to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no discussion of this case with the passenger Gabriel Maier
--Mr. Riggs is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet. The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
recess 1:57 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on March 16th at 9:40am-only counsel need to appear,  (2) Preliminary Hearing on May 6th at 9:00am
